basics.name: Dylan Barth
basics.label: Full-stack Web Developer
basics.summary: Full-stack web developer at GrowthIntel. Working in a small team on a predictive marketing tool that optimizes sales pipelines. Technologies I get to use every day include Python, Elasticsearch, JavaScript, React.js, MySQL, Git. Prior to GrowthIntel, I co-founded a small non-profit called Learning Equality where we built an open-source app that helped to provide access to an engaging learning experience for students around the world without internet access.

work.summary: As a software engineer at Growth Intel, I have had the opportunity to tackle a wide breadth of technical challenges including:
highlights: Leading a team in delivering a from-scratch rewrite of our previous frontend codebase in React in 6 weeks.
Refactoring a monolithic Python Tornado API into 4 domain separated microservices.
Pairing with another developer to build a microservice which integrated our web app with Salesforce.com using the SFDC REST API
Giving a talk at PyData London 2015 on building complex data processing pipelines with Python Luigi
Working with a wide variety of web technologies including Elasticsearch, Apache Spark, and AWS (EC2, RDS, IAM, S3).

work.summary: Learning Equality is a non-profit organization committed to enabling global access to high-quality open educational resources.
highlights: Core developer of the initial KA Lite platform, a pure Python web app which provided offline learning communities access to Khan Academy content and an interactive learning experience.
Raised over $300K in grants and donations within the first year of the organization being founded.
Led development of key partnerships with organizations including UNICEF, War Child Holland, and the Hewlett Foundation.
